alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Dougherty; Lee; Randolph; Terrell; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Georgia and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in south central Georgia, Worth. In southwest Georgia, Calhoun, Dougherty, Lee, Randolph and Terrell. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morgan, Albany, Leesburg, Edison, Arlington, Leary, Walker, Warwick, Sasser, Armena, Byne Crossroads, Palmyra, Forrester, Chickasawhatchee, Century, Jordan Place, Ducker, Herod, Clarks Mill and Starksville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Dougherty; Lee; Randolph; Terrell; Worth
